job_title: Institutional Research Coordinator in Lima, OH
pros: Hybrid workspace, teamwork, leaders focus on constant improvement
cons: Pay is a little low for industry standard

review_title: I can't give them less than 1 star?
pros: Many of the worker bees are good.
cons: Administrators and those at the top are toxic. Avoid at all costs!

review_title: Leadership does not value commitment and dedication of employees
cons: Poor pay for growing list of required duties, that take away from teaching. Administration is unapproachable and dismissive.

pros: Bad management, cut backs are bad
I really can’t think of any.
cons:
1 raise in over 2 years
Supervisors helicopter over employees
Just keep adding more tasks to your job with the same pay
Make you feel guilty about taking time off work
Bosses would let coworkers bully each other
No room for advancement

job_title: Infant Lead Teacher in Lima, OH
pros: Enjoyed being close to the YMCA, was extremely nice for before or after work. Brand new equipment and classrooms. A lot of community trainings.
cons: Low Pay had it's downside with all of the hard work managing children all day. Management could be seen as micro-managing on a daily basis.

job_title: IR Programmer Analyst in Lima, OH
cons: Upper management horrible. Have changed since then, but still some problems remain. No focus. Everone doing their own thing. Puts excessive pressure on service departments (IT, HR, Payrole, etc).

pros: Nice work areas and pretty landscaping.
cons: Rhodes needs a CIO in order to move the college forward. Current director does not have any external experience; she has never worked anywhere else other than Rhodes.

review_title: Great People trying to do a tough job
job_title: Director of Information Systems in Lima, OH
cons: Pay is low and hours are long

review_title: This was the absolute worst job I ever had.  Stay away, this place is bad news.
pros: Nothing is good about this place; nothing.  The benefits suck.  The attitude of the admin sucks.  The buildings suck.  It is awful.
cons: Stupid administrators, politics, no real understanding of how an academic institution of that size should be ran; s lot of chiefs and too few Indians

pros: Good people and environment. Flexible hours thatwork around your class schedule
cons: Low pay, high demand. Its a great way to keep fresh on statistics while being paid to help others. So many drop or fail class on this subject they need more.

pros: Deans and Professors are amazing to work with and for.
cons: President and Vice-Presidents are micro-managers.    Staff is on a running carrousel, changeover is constant.  Tenures are about 18 months and then they leave or are fired.  President doesn’t care if people leave.

review_title: DO NOT CONSIDER WORKING HERE - MENTALLY and VERBALLY ABUSIVE
pros: Nothing is positive about works ng here.
cons: Do an Internet search for Stop the Madness at Rhodes State College and you will see what former employees have said about working at this place for years.

review_title: Incompetent administration and below average pay.
pros: Helping some students who are prepared for college-level academic study.
cons: A small, poorly run community college with no academic standards or student achievement expectations.
